author: Melanie Grayce West
title: Thousands of Serial Traffic Violators in New York City Go Unpunished
text:
Last week’s deadly collision in Brooklyn that killed two children has revived calls for a crackdown on traffic violations across the city. But an analysis of city data shows how difficult it has been for law enforcement to deter even the most egregious offenders.
City records of violations issued by automated red-light and speed-zone cameras show that the license plate that was on the car involved in last week’s deadly crash had been cited four times for running red lights and four times for speeding in school zones between...
